meanings.definition: A type of footwear worn over shoes to protect them from water or dirt.
meanings.sent1: She put on her overboots before going out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The hiker wore overboots to keep her shoes dry during the hike.
meanings.sent3: The overboots danced in the puddles, keeping the shoes underneath perfectly clean.
meanings.sent4: His overboots were like shields, guarding his shoes from any harm.
meanings.sent5: The overboots were like little raincoats for his shoes, keeping them safe and dry.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect with overboots.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overboots her favorite shoes to keep them clean.
meanings.sent2: The workers overbootsed their boots before entering the cleanroom.
meanings.sent3: He overbootsed the muddy path with care, ensuring no dirt would touch his shoes.
meanings.sent4: The gardener overbootsed the delicate flowers, shielding them from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The knight overbootsed his armor, adding an extra layer of protection before battle.
